page.title: 16Cheriton Fitz - Building
page.content: Characteristic East Devon rolling hills, valleys, fields and small woods. "The Village" described in these pages is Cheriton Fitzpaine,the remaining is{farmhouses}with clusters of barns and out buildings and their surrounding fields except, for the small parish of Stockleigh English centred on the Church, the big house,Stockleigh Court and three dwellings,not much building here between the wars. Three{Council {Estates,}each of about a dozen houses, were built after the 1939-45 war,three private{developments}have added some 50 bungalows & houses since 1945. Special features {are the Trim -Tram an upper story annexe to the school on stilts over the footpath & the remains of cobbled paths of hewn local stone believed built by Napoleonic prisoners
